sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"计划"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: plan, design, plot, scheme, project, blueprint, programme
means: plan ： 最普通常用词，多指事先经过较充分的准备或考虑后制定的计划，也可指非决定性的打算或设想。
design ： 侧重指按照目标、目的意向，根据固定格式精心作出的计划或安排。
plot ： 主要指为实现某一阴谋而拟定秘密的计划。
scheme ： 普通用词，比plan更强调计划的通盘筹划和某些细节的精心安排。在现代英语中，常用于指阴谋诡计。
project ： 多指由个人或集体为进行某项工作或完成某一项较大的任务，而制定的计划方案或设想。
blueprint ： 从本义蓝图，引申指详细而具体的行动计划。
programme ： 使用广泛，既可指思想上的计划，又可指任何形式的书面计划或规划。

sentence.Network_en: A former associate of Mr. Pierce's was among the project's boosters.
sentence.Network_cn: 皮尔斯先生的一个前合伙人是这个计划的热心支持者之一。

sentence.Network_en: The total cost of the project would be more than $240 million.
sentence.Network_cn: 该项目的总成本会超过2.4亿美元。

sentence.Network_en: The Channel Tunnel project is the biggest civil engineering project in Europe.
sentence.Network_cn: 英吉利海峡隧道是欧洲最大的土木工程。

BEC英语词汇整理(7) ... product portfolio 产品组合 projected adj. 预计的, 推断的 plummet vi. （价格）骤跌, 股价崩盘.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'preliminary design, tabulated statement'): from Latin projectum 'something prominent', neuter past participle of proicere 'throw forth', from pro- 'forth' + jacere 'to throw'. Early senses of the verb were 'plan, devise' and 'cause to move forward'

encyclopedia.content: 《project》杂志是维珍品牌创始人Richard Branson创办的Pad专有杂志， Project新闻杂志涉及多个领域，包括环境、旅行、商业、设计以及国际文化等。该杂志已于2010年11月30日发布。

entry.def: A project is a task that requires a lot of time and effort.

example.ex: Money will also go into local development projects in Vietnam...
example.tran: 钱也会用于越南的地方发展项目当中。

entry.def: A project is a detailed study of a subject by a pupil or student.

example.ex: Students complete projects for a personal tutor, working at home at their own pace.
example.tran: 学生完成了做私人家教的课题，在家里按自己的步调工作。

entry.def: If something is projected, it is planned or expected.

example.ex: Africa's mid-1993 population is projected to more than double by 2025...
example.tran: 预计到2025年，非洲的人口会是1993年年中人口的两倍多。

example.ex: The government had been projecting a 5% consumer price increase for the entire year.
example.tran: 政府预测全年消费价格将增长5%。

entry.def: If you project someone or something in a particular way, you try to make people see them in that way. If you project a particular feeling or quality, you show it in your behaviour.

example.ex: Bradley projects a natural warmth and sincerity...
example.tran: 布拉德利表现出一种自然的热情和真诚。

example.ex: He just hasn't been able to project himself as the strong leader...
example.tran: 他根本没能表现出一个强有力的领导者的样子。

entry.tran: 把（情感、想法）投射转移（到他人身上）
entry.def: If you project feelings or ideas on to other people, you imagine that they have the same ideas or feelings as you.

example.ex: He projects his own thoughts and ideas onto her.
example.tran: 他以为她有着和自己相同的想法和观点。

entry.def: If you project a film or picture onto a screen or wall, you make it appear there.

example.ex: The team tried projecting the maps with two different projectors onto the same screen.
example.tran: 这个小组想用两台不同的投影仪把这些地图投射到同一个屏幕上。

entry.def: If something projects, it sticks out above or beyond a surface or edge.

example.ex: ...the remains of a war-time defence which projected out from the shore.
example.tran: 海滨凸立着的战时防御工事的遗迹

means.word_mean: 1. any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted;
2. extend out or project in space;

sentences.sentence: "A single rock sticks out from the cliff"

means.word_mean: 3. transfer (ideas or principles) from one domain into another

sentences.sentence: "The images are projected onto the screen"

means.word_mean: 7. make or work out a plan for; devise;
9. imagine; conceive of; see in one's mind;

sentences.sentence: "I can see a risk in this strategy"
"She threw the flashlight beam into the corner"

auth_sentence.res_content: There seemed to be no end of this project.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There seemed to be no end of this project.

Sentence.sentence: She was busy finishing her project.
I'm involved in several projects and it's a long working day.
Paul, tell me about the special project you mentioned on the phone.
the wireless carrier offering the iPhone in the United States, had a more reliable network, said Andrew Yu, mobile devices platform project manager at M.I.T.
To discuss the content of a project report.

sentences.en: Can you project a new working scheme for us?
sentences.cn: 你能为我们设计一个新的工作计划吗?

sentences.en: He project-ed himself into the hero's situation.
sentences.cn: 他设想自己处于那个英雄的处境中。

sentences.en: I had no screen, so I projected the slides onto an old white sheet.
sentences.cn: 我没有幕布, 所以我把幻灯片投射到一块旧的白床单上。

means.word_mean: 使(观念等)心中形成；使(思想、感情等)形象化；把(自己的感情、思想等)投射给他人

sentences.en: Don't project your guilt feelings onto me!
sentences.cn: 别把你自己内疚的感情往我身上搬。

means.word_mean: 使落于平面； 【几何学】画投影图；画投影线

sentences.en: to project a vertical line from point A upward to B

means.word_mean: 伸出, 突出; 表达特点

sentences.en: He stood at a balcony that projects over the entrance.
sentences.cn: 他站在入口上面突出的阳台上。

sentences.en: The wall is projected in the middle.

means.word_mean: 项目, 计划, 方案, 课题

sentences.en: In their geography class, the children are doing a special project on North American Indians.
sentences.cn: 在地理课上, 孩子们正在做一个有关北美印第安人的特别作业。

sentences.en: The new dam is a major construction project, funded by the government.
sentences.cn: 新水坝是政府出资建造的一个大工程项目。

sentences.en: You are projecting again, but I'm not angry with you.
sentences.cn: 你又在以己度人了，但我没有生你的气。

sentences.en: I wouldn't go projecting off into the woods alone.
sentences.cn: 我可不独自一人到树林里去闲逛。

jushi.english: Nails that project may tear your clothes.
jushi.chinese: 突出的钉子会刮坏你的衣服。

jushi.english: He stood at a balcony that projects over the entrance.
jushi.chinese: 他站在入口上面突出的阳台上。
